basics.name: Andrea Piras
basics.summary: Ph.D. student in Computer Science at the University of Illinois Chicago, specializing in causality and graph-based learning. His research focuses on modeling causal relationships in relational data using graph representations. Lead author of a paper accepted at UAI 2025 introducing RelFCI—an extension of the FCI algorithm that accounts for latent confounders and non-i.i.d. structures.

work.summary: Teaching Assistant for Introduction to Data Science (CS418).
Developing an algorithm for causal discovery on relational data using graph representations.

work.company: Northeastern University - Brigham and Women’s Hospital
work.summary: Master’s thesis on data engineering and representation learning in the biomedical domain.
Contributed to multiple research projects in computing and engineering.

education.area: M.S. in Computer Science and Engineering
B.S. in Engineering of Computing Systems

publications.name: Relational Causal Discovery with Latent Confounders
publications.summary: Introduced RelFCI, an algorithm extending FCI to relational data with latent confounders and non-i.i.d. assumptions.

projects.name: Data Extraction and Analysis using Knowledge Graphs
projects.description: Developed a pipeline for extracting and integrating Compound-Protein Interaction data to improve machine learning performance.

projects.name: Automatic Domain Specific Genome Graph Partitioning
projects.description: Developed algorithms and alignment tools to optimize genome graph partitioning.

projects.name: GAGET - Genome Assembly Graph Evaluation Toolkit
projects.description: Tool to evaluate genome assembly quality and visualize genome graphs.

projects.name: Graph Analytics of Electric Networks
projects.description: Created metrics and visualization tools for criticality analysis in electric grids.
